Description: Responsibilities of the Executive Assistant :- Resourcefully manage (master schedule) an ever-changing and robust calendar for Partners, with regular high-level direct contact with clients and internal leadership- Handle sensitive information pertaining to clients, technical managers, and partners’ personal and family matters- Coordinate and plan meeting details (virtual or in person) – including location, IT and media details (video and/or conferencing software and linkages), catering needs, and other arrangements- Coordinate general support and logistics in the department- Coordinate special requests and various ad hoc projects assigned by the Partners or senior leadership- Represent the firm through professional correspondence with external clients and other various communication channels (phone, text, email)Skills
Skills: - 7-10+ years of full-time work experience as a high-level Executive Assistant
- Experience in corporate or financial services preferred
- Distinctive written and verbal communication skills
- High level of accuracy and attention to detail

- Excellent organizational skills; ability to manage own workload, prioritize conflicting demands, multi-task, and always deliver high-quality products while adhering to tight and structured deadlines
- Ability to maintain composure during demanding situations resulting from deadlines or heavy workloads by anticipating needs
- Proactive and able to work on own initiative while having the confidence to ask questions when unsure
- Flexible approach is essential to manage both day-to-day work and ad hoc requests
- Discreet with the ability to handle sensitive information in confidence
- Must always maintain a professional demeanor
- Strong work ethic and attention to detail and must show care in their work
- Verification of identity, education, prior employment, and references may be required
